title: Exeter sign Australia international scrum half Nic White
title_page: Exeter sign Australia international scrum half Nic White | Daily Mail Online
text:
Exeter have announced the signing of Australia international scrum-half Nic White and Jersey back row forward James Freeman on two-year deals.
White, who has won 22 caps for the Wallabies, will move to the Sandy Park outfit from French Top 14 club Montpellier and play in the Aviva Premiership next season.
Chiefs head coach Rob Baxter said: 'I just think when a player of Nic's quality becomes available - and he shows an interest in coming to the club - you have to act quickly.
Exeter have announced the signing of Australia scrum-half Nic White (second left)
White, who has 22 caps for the Wallabies, will move to Sandy Park from Top 14 club Montpellier
'If you look at how he has played, not just at Super Rugby and international level, but also more recently over in France with Montpellier, to me he is exactly the kind of signing you want to bring to the club.
'I have no doubt he will add great competition to the scrum-halves we have already at the club, but he will also be great for the young players to learn from as well.
'He will add a real sense of direction and game understanding to us, which I know is going to be important moving forward.'
Reflecting on signing Freeman, Baxter added: 'A bit like Nic, James ticks a lot of boxes for us.
'We keep a very close eye on the Championship. I have watched a lot of James' games in detail, and again even before we met him, we saw that he had a lot of the qualities and the potential we think to do well in the Premiership.'
Jersey back row forward James Freeman (left) will also join Exeter on a two-year deal
